caption: I rarely write reviews, but this place certainly deserves one! I ordered via Uber Eats and the food was absolutely amazing! Everything was fresh, healthy and super delicious. Prices are very democratic for the quality and portion sizes you get. I can’t wait to order again and visit in-person!

We ordered in delivery and were completely wowed by the flavors!  Definitely the best Thai food we've had, and we are big fans of our local restaurant but would say this one is tops.  We ordered a red curry and Pad Seiw and both were outstanding.
Delicious pad kee mao with soy chicken. Had perfect level of spice. Tried four vegan restaurants in the neighborhood this month, definitely my favorite dish so far!

Wonderful place! The food is delicious, vegan, reasonably priced and comes in very large portions! The ingredients are high quality and taste fresh, it's really great. The one time there was a small mistake with my order, THEY called ME within minutes to offer a correction and threw in a free side to boot! Can't recommend it highly enough. Oh and be prepared if you order it spicy, they do NOT skimp 🥵

Great location and service  The food has vibrant colors, which makes it even better.I had their electric dish (BBQ Cauliflower ) and their Committed Sandwich( Pulled Pork/Mushroom ).  Great taste and dishes.

The veggies in the Crispy Springrolls are fresh and crispy. The sauce is flavorful. Pad Thai is tasty, the noodles arrive sticky and soggy.  The curry sauce is excellent, however, there is more sauce then veggies in the dish.
My favorite vegan Thai food in Chicago! Very flavourful and consistent in quality!

I ordered food through Grubhub from here on a whim to try something new & I’m so glad I did! The fresh rice paper salad rolls (can’t remember the exact item name on the menu) are huge and super stuffed with veggies. The wonton soup is perfect for a cold day & it was light and flavorful. The mushroom steamed buns are amazing & maybe it’s five spice or some other spice,  but the sauce for those is so full of umami goodness! The pad Thai was soooo good too! I ordered it with the soy duck even though I remember not liking duck back when I ate meat, but I thought that since it’s faux duck it would just be some generic vegan meat alternative, but it’s not. It definitely reminds me of what I remember duck tasting like so I wasn’t the hugest fan, but if you like duck, get it!  I won’t deduct any stars because they upheld their promise of “duck” flavor & it’s my fault for not getting tofu or veggies instead. I will definitely be ordering again to try other dishes since I had such a good experience with my first order.
This place is amazing. Thank god I found it on grubhub. Spicy mushroom is legit soooo good.

I really love the food here. The friend rice, pad Thai, and the bao are amazing. The service is also great. We have gotten carry out twice and it has never disappointed. The food is prepared with care and it tastes delicious. Definitely recommend!
Hidden gem! So delicious

I loved my experience here, and it wasn't just because the food was great! There weren't really any other customers when my friend and I came because I think it had just reopened from the Stay-at-Home Order. The person who served us also appeared to be the owner or manager of the business because we saw him in the corner paying bills too. I really appreciated how friendly he was. He answered our personal questions about his background, Thailand, and the inspiration for the restaurant even though he didn't have to.

The curry is awesome. Awesome flavor, very spicy but not overwhelming for me and I’m a wuss to spicy stuff. I added soy duck and mixed vegetables and it came out to $17.17. Pricey for one meal but man it’s delicious. Very friendly staff too.  And by one meal I mean you’ll be STUFFED, easily 2 satiating bowls of food.

This is our first visit and also the first place we have been to for dine-in at a restaurant since the lockdown. They have a patio with large open windows and we were very comfortable. For an appetizer we tried buns which seemed pricey but were worth it! They (pleasantly) surprised us when they came out with sweet potato fries and greens too! We ordered the basil fried rice and "nutty" both with tofu and veggies. We were impressed with the delicious flavors and I loved the variety of veggies in both dishes. We can't wait to come back and try other items on the menu soon!
Very impressed with everything we ordered. Solid portion sizes too. Will likely be eating here a lot.
Such fresh food and very delicious! Can’t wait to be able to dine in soon.

This might be my favorite restaurant of all time. I strongly encourage everyone, both vegan and non-vegan, to give it a try. The rice berry is excellent, it's like brown rice with the texture of white rice. My favorite dishes are the pad kee mao (delicious noodles in sauce) and the basil dish, and the buns are great too. If you don't like spice, make sure you ask for a mild version of whatever you decide to order. I love spicy food, though, so to me it's already perfect. Supporting local restaurants is more important than ever right now, so please get some excellent food from I'm Vegan and Vegetarian if you can!
Some of the best curry I’ve had in Chicago. Will be back.

I ordered delivery here and it was prompt and still hot! I ordered one of the curries and it was really delicious, plus the portions are pretty big, so it was a meal the next day too! This small business is awesome!
Delicious and healthy! The steamed mushroom buns were especially good, and I got plenty of food for the price.

I always drive pass this spot where it was my favorite sushi place owned by a Japanese chef but that was a long time ago... And one day, boom! This "I'm vegan & vegetarian" opens up. I was skeptical at first because of how a Thai vegan place can take over the spot... But boy, I ordered their Pad Thai with soy chicken after my first bite, all the wonderful flavors was running around my mouth and my tummy was happy again. I will definitely be back for other dishes
Ordered curry for delivery and it was incredible! Really impressed and the curry was perfectly spiced. The special rice was also extremely tasty. Highly recommend!

I became vegan about a year ago and Asian vegan would be my go to (tastier and more creative). I saw this restaurant from FB page Taste of VEGAN Chicagoland and I didn't wait to go try out their food. I went in for lunch with a co-worker and we got avocado buns, Kee Mao noodles and fried rice. Chris (owner) took a very good care of us and explain how they use rice berry for fried rice, I've never heard of it before but I'm glad I gave it a try. Everything tasted great and the restaurant was nice and clean. Thank you Chris, we will be back!

One of the spiciest meals of my life. I've eaten plenty of spicy food and Thai food before, but this was off the charts. I asked for some rice to mix in to dilute the spice and was given a very small bowl of rice and charged $4. Would not recommend.
